bibl.title: Letter from Elizabeth Peabody to Philip Showalter Hench, October 7, 1940

div1.p: Peabody informs Hench that she has her father's yellow fever slide collection and is willing to let Hench borrow it. She inquires about the Lazear Memorial Building dedication at Washington and Jefferson College.

div1.head: Letter from Elizabeth Peabody to Philip Showalter Hench, October 7, 1940

opener.dateline:
Wilson College
Chambersburg, Pa.
October 7, 1940 DEPARTMENT OF BIOLOGY
Dr. Philip S. Hench,
Mayo Clinic,
Rochester, Minnesota.

div1.p:
My father has recently
sent me your letters con-
cerning the dedication of
the Lazear Memorial Building
at Washington and Jefferson
and your part in the cere-
monies. Since he gave me
his lantern slides on yellow
fever, I wish to offer them
for your use should you
care to have them.

When I was in Havana
this September, I met Mr.
Moran and he showed me
around. He told me that when
Wilson College
Chambersburg, Pa.
DEPARTMENT OF BIOLOGY
my father was there some years
ago he had only seen the army
site. Camp Columbia has cer-
tainly changed since the day
of the experiments.

May I ask if these dedicatory
exercises at W. and J are open
to interested bacteriologists?
Some of my students might
be able to attend. And I should
also like to know why a
Lazear Memorial Building
at this college? Did he go
there?

I can send you a list of
the slides if you like. Frankly
I do not think much of the
collection.
